column5: WELL AFTER YESTERDAY ALL DAY RAIN AND TODAYS SNOW I TOOK A DRIVE BY A FEW CREEKS. UNLESS U HAVE CLASS 3 RAPID EXPERIENCE I WOULDNT BE GOIN ANYWHERE NEAR A RIVER FOR A FEW DAYS. OSHAWA CREEK IS UP ATLEAST 3FT AND MOVIN VERY FAST AND MUD. SO THOUGHT ID SAVE YA ALL A TRIP IF YA THINKIN OF GOIN TOMOR. AD IF YA ARE DUMB ENOUGH MAKE SURE YA GOT A LIFE JACKET ON  LOL
tks for the heads up, or is it, that the fishing is so good right now you want to keep us all away...
ALL YOURS BRO. FINISHIN OFF THE LAST OF CHRISTMAS SHOPPIN TOMOR :|  THEN FREE TO FISH  LOL

Drove through rain of biblical proportions this morning. Every river, creek and ditch pure brown and churning mud.  As expected our chosen river was running high with just a tinge of colour though.  Smacked the poop out of them (all bright bullet chromers) all morning then the rain changed to snow.  More than 6" fell in a very short time. Was a total blizzard LOL!  We poked a bunch more then packed it in, my hands couldn't take it anymore.  Despite the weather it was a great day 'till we got my Accord stuck in a snow covered pit of oozing mud LOL!  Tried to dig it out with the butt end of my snow scraper. Wasn't working too good LOL!  Finally after wallowing in the mud for an hour or so and the snow still falling hard I broke down and called a tow truck.  In 20 minutes we were out and enroute to the nearest powerwasher.  Tomorrow and Friday will be absolutely on fire, wish I could go.  So that's my story. Sorry to hijack your post Scott, but I wanted to tell the tale.
HIGHJACK AWAY BRO  LOL NOW IF YA DID THAT OUT HERE IN THE EAST TODAY THEN ID SAY YOUR THE MAN AND JUST GIVE U MY PIN AND ROD  LOL
I avoid the east like the plague.  If you pm me I'd be happy to point you in the right direction though.  (NOTE: This offer doesn't apply to everyone who's reading this.
OFFER IS DUELY NOTED. USUALLY STAY CLOSE TO HOME. BUT ONE OF THESE DAYS I WOULDNT MIND SHARING A DRIFT WITH YA AND SOME STORIES.
Yea my home trib is just about over it's banks luckily I know a couple smaller systems that clear fast be careful if your out fishing fast cold water can be a real bugger if ya go swimming.
Bronte looks like an outhouse in mexico!!!
WELL I NEVER>.....
Thanks CC, saved me a trip for Thursday morning. I'll be out quite often after the 16th, my last finals. Hope to see you on the water.
Here's where I got stuck

you tried to dig that out with that blue snow brush???????????   to bad you dont come to the east end to fish. theres lots of OFC'rs here that would have came out to help you. of course we would reserve the right to post all the pictures of you on your knee's with the snow brush...LOL  well atleast you got out safe.
Yeah you can see the snow brush in the background.  There was some pretty choice commentary while I was digging let me tell ya.

I'm sure you meant pics of him down on his knees digging...but all I could think of was him doing the "Solo pose" with the scraper, instead of a fish  And yeah...I'll bet there were some choice words...I hope this doesn't mean you got rid of the X-Trail?
Not sure how good your tires are, but the Icelander secret to get out of snow is to deflate your tires a bit to provide more traction.

Smart   It was the first trip the entire fall I didn't drive the truck, go figure.     Ummmm....yeah. No way I was going to that in a mud pit with a front wheel drive sedan.  Seriously I wasted a lot of time digging with the ice scraper and getting pretty frustrated.  Tow truck guy was there 15 mins after I called and only charged 20 bucks.
Open the hood and get somebody sitting on that flat spot. Get weight on tires and it will walk out.
That makes total sense.
20 bucks and alittle muck, small price to pay for a good day on the water
